newsitem.title: USA: US spot LPGs stable ahead of Easter holiday.
newsitem.headline: US spot LPGs stable ahead of Easter holiday.

text.p: U.S. liquefied petroleum gas prices were largely stable in quiet late trade on Thursday ahead of the Easter holiday, players said.
Players said activity was extremely thin since many left their offices early for the long weekend.
The markets will be closed Friday.
In the U.S. Gulf Coast, Mont Belvieu, Texas, spot propane was pegged between 37.00 cents and 37.25 cents a gallon.
Players said most of the positions for March had closed up earlier in the week and trading activity is not expected to pick up until April 1. ((--Laney Salisbury, New York Energy Desk 1212 859-1631))
